head.title: Technology Briefing | Telecommunications: Verizon Reports A Loss

hedline.hl1: Technology Briefing | Telecommunications: Verizon Reports A Loss

body.head.byline: By Simon Romero (NYT) (Compiled by Alan Krauss)

abstract.p: Verizon Communications reports third-quarter net of $1.86 billion, compared with $3.47 billion in year-earlier period (S)

block.p: Verizon Communications, the nation's largest local telephone company, said yesterday that earnings fell 46 percent in the third quarter, to $1.86 billion, or 69 cents a share, from $3.47 billion, or $1.27, in the comparable quarter a year earlier. Verizon, which was formed last year by Bell Atlantic's acquisition of the GTE Corporation, said sales in the quarter had climbed 2.8 percent, to $17 billion. The company's financial performance was hurt by the Sept. 11 attacks, which destroyed switching equipment in Lower Manhattan, and by weaker demand for telephone services.

Correction: November 2, 2001, Friday A headline in the Technology Briefing column of Business Day on Wednesday about the third-quarter financial results of Verizon Communications misstated them. Profit declined by 46 percent; the company did not report a loss.
